message.content:
{"id": "5340", "title": "Bug 5340: Cancelling add exception breakpoint has no effect", "description": "When adding an exception breakpoint in the debug perspective, cancelling the operation does not have any effect. The progress dialog closes immediately and eventually, the exception list comes up, ignoring the cancellation request. This behavior should either honor the cancellation request or disable the cancel button. When calling ProgressMonitorDialog.run, the 'cancellable' parameter should be set to false.", "OB": "1) Open the debug perspective.
2) Go to the breakpoints pane.
3) Click the 'J!' button to add an exception breakpoint.
4) In the progress dialog, click cancel.", "EB": "The progress dialog should close immediately when the cancel button is clicked and the exception list should not be displayed. The cancellation request should be honored and the cancel button should be disabled during the operation. When calling ProgressMonitorDialog.run, pass false for the 'cancellable' parameter.", "SR": "1) Open the debug perspective.
2) Go to the breakpoints pane.
3) Click the 'J!' button to add an exception breakpoint.
4) In the progress dialog, click cancel."}

', 'SR': '1) Go to the breakpoints pane in the debug perspective2) Click the J! button to add an exception3) In the progress dialog, click cancel. '}
